column4: Hey I got a question here, I've been looking around on the forum and couldn't find an answer.
I'm trying to put Ubuntu on my iBook and the CD drive on it is dead so I can't use the CDs, all I got is an iPod, is it possible to install from that one?
if you can boot from a usb device, yes
did you read the first link?
- Jah I did, and I tried that too.
- I don't want to install linux on the iPod, I want to be able to install -from- it. Like some how copy the CD-image of the install CD to the iPod and install on the iBooks own hardisk.
yes i know, thats what that how to is for
you have to put it on it before you can boot from it and install form it
maybe you can just put the .iso file of the install disk on it and boot from the ipod
- Well I assume I gotta make the drive bootable some how.
right, there a section in that last link i posted, about making it bootable
- On the iBook it's OS X 10.4.6 (I think) it's 10.4.something at any rate.
you might be able to try this method: http://ftp.ubuntulinux.org/ubuntu/dists/warty/main/installer-i386/current/doc/manual/en/apcs03.html
